title: Keto Waffles
description: Crispy on the outside, fluffy inside — these easy Keto Waffles are made with almond flour and eggs for a low-carb, gluten-free breakfast ready in 20 minutes.
ingredients: 1 tbsp erythritol or monk fruit sweetener (optional)
2 tbsp melted butter or coconut oil
Nonstick spray or oil for waffle iron
Optional toppings: keto syrup, nut butter, berries

instructions.title: Preheat Waffle Iron
instructions.description: Preheat your waffle iron to medium heat and lightly grease with oil or nonstick spray.
instructions.name: Nonstick Waffle Maker

instructions.title: Mix Dry Ingredients
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix almond flour, baking powder, salt, and optional sweetener.
instructions.name: Measuring Spoons
instructions.name1: Set of Mixing Bowl & many more items

instructions.title: Add Wet Ingredients
instructions.description: Whisk in eggs, melted butter, almond milk, and vanilla until a smooth batter forms.
instructions.name: Pack of 3 Silicon whisk

instructions.title: Cook the Waffles
instructions.description: Pour batter into waffle iron and cook for 3–4 minutes or until golden brown and firm.
instructions.name: Waffle Iron

instructions.title: Serve and Top
instructions.description: Let waffles cool slightly and serve with keto-friendly toppings like berries or syrup.
instructions.name: Pack of 3 Silicone Tongs

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve hot with keto syrup, nut butter, or berries.
serving_and_storage.store: Store in the fridge for 3–4 days or freeze for 2 months. Reheat in toaster or oven.

pro_tips: Use a silicone spatula or tongs to avoid scratching the waffle iron.
Let cooked waffles rest on a wire rack to stay crisp.
Add a dash of cinnamon or cocoa powder for flavor.

title: Strawberry Muffins
description: Delicious and fluffy muffins loaded with fresh strawberries.
ingredients: 2/3 cup organic cane sugar or coconut sugar
1 tbsp apple cider vinegar (or lemon juice)
1/3 cup vegetable oil or melted coconut oil

instructions.title: Prep the Oven & Muffin Pan
instructions.description: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease muffin pan or line with silicone baking cups.
instructions.name: Nonstick Muffin Pan – 12 Cup

instructions.title: Make Vegan Buttermilk
instructions.description: Combine almond milk and apple cider vinegar in a bowl. Stir and let sit for 5 minutes to curdle slightly.
instructions.name: Mixing Bowls – Nested Set

instructions.title: Mix the Dry Ingredients
instructions.description: In a large mixing bowl, sift and whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
instructions.name: Silicone Spatula Set

instructions.title: Mix the Wet Ingredients
instructions.description: In another bowl, mix prepared vegan buttermilk, oil, and vanilla extract.
instructions.name: Fine Mesh Sifter

instructions.title: Combine Wet & Dry
instructions.description: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Mix gently until just combined. Do not overmix.

instructions.title: Fold in the Strawberries
instructions.description: Fold in the diced strawberries using a spatula. Make sure they are dry before adding.

instructions.title: Fill the Muffin Cups
instructions.description: Scoop batter into muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.

instructions.title: Bake
instructions.description: Bake for 22–25 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

instructions.title: Cool
instructions.description: Let muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack.
instructions.name: Strawberry Huller & Dicer Tool

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm or at room temperature.
serving_and_storage.store: Store in an airtight container at room temperature for 2–3 days, or refrigerate up to 5 days. Freeze up to 2 months.

pro_tips: Sprinkle sugar on top before baking for a crisp top.
Swap strawberries for blueberries or raspberries for variation.
Use frozen berries straight from the freezer, dusted in flour.

title: Baked Pumpkin Oatmeal Cups
description: Soft, spiced, and naturally sweet baked pumpkin oatmeal cups that are perfect for meal prep and on-the-go breakfasts. Vegan and gluten-free.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice (or 1/4 tsp each nutmeg & cloves)
1 cup plant milk (like almond or oat)
Optional: 1/4 cup chocolate chips or chopped nuts

instructions.title: Preheat Oven and Prepare Pan
instructions.description: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease or line a 12-cup muffin pan with liners.
instructions.name: 12-Cup Muffin Pan

instructions.title: Mix Dry Ingredients
instructions.description: In a large bowl, whisk together oats, baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin spice, and salt.
instructions.name: Set of 12 items with Mixing Bowl

instructions.title: Add Wet Ingredients
instructions.description: Stir in pumpkin puree, maple syrup, plant milk, vanilla, and oil or nut butter. Mix until combined.
instructions.name: 4 pieces of Silicone Spatula

instructions.title: Fill the Muffin Cups
instructions.description: Scoop batter into muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full. Add optional toppings if desired.
instructions.name: Set of 3 Cookie Scoop

instructions.title: Bake and Cool
instructions.description: Bake for 25–28 minutes until tops are set and edges are golden. Cool in pan before transferring to rack.
instructions.name: Set of 2 Cooling Rack

serving_and_storage.serve: Enjoy warm or chilled with a drizzle of nut butter or maple syrup.
serving_and_storage.store: Store in fridge up to 5 days or freeze for 2 months in airtight containers.

pro_tips: Use silicone muffin liners for easy release.
Add chopped apples or raisins for variation.
Drizzle almond butter or vegan yogurt on top for extra richness.

title: Banana Oatmeal Pancakes
description: These Banana Oatmeal Pancakes are a delicious and healthy breakfast option. Made with simple ingredients, they are vegan, gluten-free, and packed with flavor.
ingredients: 3/4 cup unsweetened almond milk (or any plant milk)
Coconut oil or vegan butter for cooking

instructions.title: Blend the Dry Base
instructions.description: Add 1 cup of rolled oats to a high-speed blender or food processor and blend until it becomes a fine flour.
instructions.name: High-Speed Blender or Food Processor

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Add banana, almond milk, flaxseed, maple syrup, baking powder, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt to the oat flour in the blender. Blend until smooth. Let batter rest 5 minutes to thicken.
instructions.name: Masher or Fork

instructions.title: Heat the Pan
instructions.description: Heat a nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Lightly brush with coconut oil or vegan butter.
instructions.name: Oil Brush or Dispenser

instructions.title: Cook the Pancakes
instructions.description: Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the skillet. Cook for 2–3 minutes until bubbles form and edges firm. Flip and cook for 1–2 minutes more.
instructions.name: Nonstick Skillet or Griddle

instructions.title: Repeat and Serve
instructions.description: Repeat until all batter is used. Serve pancakes warm with banana slices, maple syrup, nut butter, or berries.
instructions.name: Measuring Cups & Spoons Set

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm with your favorite toppings.
serving_and_storage.store: Refrigerate up to 3 days in an airtight container or freeze with parchment between layers.

pro_tips: Add vegan chocolate chips to the batter for a treat.
Mix in a scoop of vegan protein powder for a protein boost.
Thin the batter slightly with more milk for thinner pancakes.

title: Avocado Toast with Egg
description: Creamy avocado spread on toasted bread, topped with a perfectly poached egg.
ingredients: 2 slices of whole grain or sourdough bread
Salt and black pepper to taste

instructions.title: Toast the Bread
instructions.description: Toast the bread slices in a toaster or toaster oven until golden brown and crispy.
instructions.name: 4-Slot Toaster or Toaster Oven

instructions.title: Mash the Avocado
instructions.description: Scoop the avocado into a bowl, add lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mash with a fork until creamy but slightly chunky.
instructions.name: Serrated Bread Knife

instructions.title: Cook the Eggs
instructions.description: Cook the eggs to your preference (fried, poached, or boiled) and season with salt and pepper.
instructions.name: Nonstick Frying Pan or Skillet

instructions.title: Assemble the Toast
instructions.description: Spread mashed avocado on toasted bread. Top with cooked egg and optional toppings like red pepper flakes or feta.
instructions.name: Silicone Spatula

serving_and_storage.serve: Best fresh, but cooked eggs can be made ahead and gently reheated.
serving_and_storage.store: Store mashed avocado with lemon juice in the fridge for 1 day.

pro_tips: Use ripe avocados for best texture and flavor.
Add cucumber or radish slices for extra crunch.
Top with smoked salmon or sautéed greens to make it more filling.

title: Italian Sandwich with Basil Pesto
description: A classic Italian sandwich with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil pesto on ciabatta bread.
ingredients: 1 small ciabatta loaf or 2 pieces of baguette
A handful of fresh basil leaves

instructions.title: Slice the Bread
instructions.description: Slice the ciabatta or baguette horizontally to make a sandwich base. Toast lightly if desired.
instructions.name: Serrated Bread Knife

instructions.title: Spread the Pesto
instructions.description: Spread basil pesto evenly on the cut sides of the bread using a spatula or spreader.
instructions.name: Tomato Slicer or Sharp Chef’s Knife

instructions.title: Layer the Ingredients
instructions.description: Layer with mozzarella slices, tomato slices (seasoned with salt and pepper), basil leaves, and optional arugula or drizzle of balsamic.
instructions.name: Tomato Slicer or Sharp Chef’s Knife

instructions.title: Close & Toast (Optional)
instructions.description: Close the sandwich and toast it in a panini press or skillet for 2–3 minutes per side until golden and melty.
instructions.name: Pesto Spreader or Silicone Spatula

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Slice in half and serve immediately with a side of chips or salad.
instructions.name: Cheese Slicer or Mozzarella Knife

serving_and_storage.serve: Best when fresh. If prepping ahead, add tomatoes just before eating to avoid sogginess.
serving_and_storage.store: Wrap tightly and store up to 24 hours in the refrigerator.

pro_tips: Use heirloom or vine-ripened tomatoes for best flavor.
Sprinkle flaky salt on the tomato slices to enhance sweetness.
Add grilled veggies or avocado to make it more filling.

title: Cottage Cheese Egg Salad
description: A creamy, protein-packed twist on classic egg salad made with cottage cheese instead of mayo. Light, satisfying, and perfect for sandwiches, wraps, or bowls.
ingredients: Optional: 1 tsp lemon juice or pickle juice
Optional: chopped celery, green onions, herbs (dill, parsley), or everything bagel seasoning

instructions.title: Boil the Eggs
instructions.description: Place eggs in a saucepan, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Once boiling, cover and remove from heat. Let sit for 10–12 minutes.
instructions.name: Saucepan with Lid

instructions.title: Cool and Peel
instructions.description: Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water to cool for 5 minutes. Then peel and set aside.
instructions.name: Mixing Bowl

instructions.title: Chop the Eggs
instructions.description: Chop the boiled eggs to your desired texture and add to a mixing bowl.
instructions.name: Egg Slicer or Knife

instructions.title: Add Cottage Cheese
instructions.description: Add 1/2 cup cottage cheese to the chopped eggs.
instructions.name: Measuring Cup

instructions.title: Season the Mixture
instructions.description: Add salt, pepper, mustard, and any optional ingredients like paprika or lemon juice. Stir gently to combine.
instructions.name: Silicone Spatula

instructions.title: Serve and Enjoy
instructions.description: Serve in lettuce wraps, on toast, or in a sandwich. Store leftovers in the fridge up to 3 days.
instructions.name: Serving Plate or Container

serving_and_storage.serve: Best served cold on toast, crackers, in lettuce wraps, or with veggies.
serving_and_storage.store: Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

pro_tips: Use full-fat cottage cheese for the creamiest texture.
Egg slicers make chopping super quick and even.
For extra flavor, mix in chopped pickles or herbs.

title: Buffalo Tofu Wrap –Totally Vegan!
description: If you're craving something spicy, protein-packed, and satisfying, Perfect for lunch, dinner.
ingredients: 2–3 large flour tortillas (or whole wheat wraps)
¼ cup thinly sliced red onions

instructions.title: Press the Tofu
instructions.description:
Why press tofu? 
 Tofu is packed in water, and before cooking, it’s essential to remove as much moisture as possible. Pressing helps the tofu become firmer, allowing it to absorb flavors better and crisp up when cooked. 
 How to press it: 
 Tofu press method: Place the tofu block in a tofu press, tighten, and let it sit for 15–20 minutes. 
 Manual method: Wrap tofu in a clean kitchen towel or a few paper towels. Place it on a plate and set something heavy on top (like a skillet or a book). Let it press for 15–20 minutes.Pro tip: The longer you press, the better the texture—especially for stir-fries or pan-frying
instructions.name: Tofu Press

instructions.title: Cook the Tofu
instructions.description: Pan-fry tofu in a nonstick skillet for 2–3 minutes per side until golden and crispy, or air fry at 375°F for 12–15 minutes
instructions.name: Chef’s Knife & Cutting Board

instructions.title: Make the Buffalo Sauce
instructions.description: Whisk together hot sauce, vegan butter, and garlic powder. Toss cooked tofu in the sauce until fully coated.
instructions.name: Mixing Bowl Set

instructions.title: Assemble the Wrap
instructions.description: On a tortilla, layer lettuce, carrots, avocado, buffalo tofu, and other desired toppings. Drizzle with vegan ranch.
instructions.name: Nonstick Skillet or Air Fryer

instructions.title: Roll It Up
instructions.description: Fold in the sides and roll into a tight wrap. Slice in half and serve.
instructions.name: Oil Sprayer or Silicone Brush

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve with sweet potato fries, celery sticks, or a side salad.
serving_and_storage.store: Store tofu and veggies separately up to 3 days,Reheat tofu in skillet or air fryer before assembling wrap,Assemble wrap just before eating to avoid sogginess.

pro_tips: Mix buffalo sauce with vegan mayo for a milder version.
Add chickpeas or quinoa for extra texture and protein.
Use gluten-free or spinach tortillas for variation.

title: Cheesy Chili Mac– Comfort Food
description: a comfort food classic that’s a cross between hearty chili and cheesy macaroni. It’s perfect for weeknight dinners and a big hit with families.

instructions.title: Sauté Aromatics
instructions.description: Heat oil in a large skillet. Cook onion until softened, then add garlic and cook 1 more minute.
instructions.name: Non stick skillet

instructions.title: Brown the Meat
instructions.description: Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up as it cooks.
instructions.name: Sillicone Spatula

instructions.title: Add Seasonings
instructions.description: Stir in chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook 1 minute.
instructions.name: Measuring Cups & Spoons Set

instructions.title: Add Sauce and Beans
instructions.description: Stir in tomato sauce, beans, and broth. Mix well.

instructions.title: Add Macaroni
instructions.description: Add uncooked macaroni. Cover and simmer 10–12 minutes until pasta is cooked.

instructions.title: Stir in Cheese
instructions.description: Turn off heat and stir in shredded cheese until melted.
instructions.name: Box grater

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Scoop into bowls and garnish with more cheese or toppings.

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve hot in bowls with extra shredded cheese, sour cream, or jalapeños if desired.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. Reheat on the stove with a splash of broth.

pro_tips: Substitute ground beef with plant-based crumbles for a vegetarian version.
Add a dash of hot sauce for extra spice.
Shred your own cheddar for best melting quality.

title: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
description: These roasted sweet potatoes are loaded with a flavorful mix of black beans, corn, avocado, and cheese.

instructions.title: Bake the Sweet Potatoes
instructions.description: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Prick sweet potatoes with a fork, place on parchment-lined baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, and bake for 45–50 minutes until tender.
instructions.name: Baking tray

instructions.title: Prepare the Filling
instructions.description: Mix black beans, corn, bell pepper, onion, avocado, lime juice, and cumin in a bowl. Season with salt to taste.
instructions.name: Mixing bowl

instructions.title: Slice and Stuff
instructions.description: Slice baked sweet potatoes lengthwise, mash the inside slightly, and stuff with the bean mixture.
instructions.name: Potato masher or fork

instructions.title: Add Toppings and Serve
instructions.description: Top with Greek yogurt, cilantro, and hot sauce. Serve warm.
instructions.name: Chef’s knife

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm topped with yogurt, herbs, or hot sauce as desired.
serving_and_storage.store: Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat in oven or microwave.

pro_tips: Use canned black beans to save time.
Add chopped jalapeños for extra heat.
For meal prep, bake potatoes ahead of time and store the filling separately.

title: Jackfruit Wings: The Plant-Based Powerhouse
description: These smoky, crispy, and saucy Jackfruit Wings are baked to perfection and tossed in your favorite BBQ or buffalo sauce — making you forget all about chicken. 100% plant-powered and crowd-approved!
ingredients: 1 can (20 oz) young green jackfruit in brine or water

instructions.title: Prepare the Jackfruit
instructions.description: Drain and rinse the jackfruit. Pat dry and shred it with hands or forks. Remove tough core bits if desired.
instructions.name: Shredding forks

instructions.title: Make the Batter
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix chickpea flour, cornstarch, spices, plant milk, and oil until smooth. Toss the jackfruit in this batter and coat well.
instructions.name: Mixing bowls

instructions.title: Bake the Jackfruit
instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Place coated jackfruit on a parchment-lined tray. Bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and crispy.
instructions.name: Baking tray

instructions.title: Toss in Sauce
instructions.description: Warm the BBQ or buffalo sauce with maple syrup. Toss baked jackfruit in sauce until fully coated.
instructions.name: Silicone basting brush

instructions.title: Bake Again & Serve
instructions.description: Return coated jackfruit to the tray and bake for 10 more minutes. Serve hot with vegan ranch and veggies.

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve hot with vegan ranch, celery, and carrot sticks. Great for parties or weeknight comfort meals.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for 3 days. Reheat in oven or air fryer for crispiness.

pro_tips: Use parchment paper or a silicone mat to prevent sticking and ease cleanup.
Toss jackfruit in sauce only after the first bake for best texture.
Try it with Korean gochujang sauce for a spicy twist!

title: Easy Vegan Mexican Rice
description: A quick and flavorful one-pot Mexican rice made with simple ingredients. Perfect as a side dish or light vegan main.
ingredients: Fresh cilantro and lime juice for garnish

instructions.title: Rinse the Rice
instructions.description: Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear. Drain thoroughly.
instructions.name: Fine Mesh Strainer

instructions.title: Sauté Onion and Garlic
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onion and garlic until translucent and aromatic.
instructions.name: Nonstick Skillet

instructions.title: Toast the Rice
instructions.description: Add rice to the skillet and cook for 3–4 minutes until lightly golden, stirring often.
instructions.name: Silicone Spatula

instructions.title: Add Tomato and Spices
instructions.description: Stir in tomato puree, cumin, chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
instructions.name: Measuring Spoon Set

instructions.title: Add Water and Simmer
instructions.description: Add water or broth. Bring to a boil, then simmer on low, covered, for 18–20 minutes.
instructions.name: Pan with Lid

instructions.title: Fluff and Garnish
instructions.description: Let rice rest 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and garnish with cilantro and lime.
instructions.name: Herb Scissors

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve hot as a side with tacos, burritos, or grilled veggies.
serving_and_storage.store: Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 4 days. Reheat in microwave or skillet.

pro_tips: Rinse rice to prevent clumping and sogginess.
Use broth instead of water for richer flavor.
Add frozen corn or peas for more variety.

title: Vegan Caramelized Onion & Spinach Pizza Rolls
description: Soft, savory pizza rolls filled with caramelized onions, garlicky spinach, marinara sauce, and melty vegan cheese. Perfect for snacks, parties, or lunchboxes.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh spinach (or 1 cup thawed frozen)
Optional: red pepper flakes, fresh herbs for garnish

instructions.title: Caramelize the Onions
instructions.description: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add sliced onions and a pinch of salt. Cook for 15–20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden and soft.
instructions.name: Most usefull tool for kitchen = Nonstick Skillet

instructions.title: Cook the Spinach
instructions.description: Add minced garlic and spinach to the skillet with onions. Sauté for 2–3 minutes until spinach is wilted. Remove from heat.
instructions.name: Garlic Press & Tongs

instructions.title: Roll Out the Dough
instructions.description: Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface into a large rectangle about 1/4 inch thick.
instructions.name: Rolling Pin

instructions.title: Add the Fillings
instructions.description: Spread marinara sauce over the dough, then layer the onion-spinach mixture and vegan cheese evenly.
instructions.name: Set of Spatula

instructions.title: Roll and Slice
instructions.description: Roll the dough from the long side into a log. Slice into 1.5-inch pieces using a sharp knife or dental floss.
instructions.name: Bread Knife or Pastry Cutter

instructions.title: Bake the Rolls
instructions.description: Place rolls in a greased or lined baking dish. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20–25 minutes until golden brown.
instructions.name: Set of 4 Ceramic Baking Dish

instructions.title: Serve and Garnish
instructions.description: Let cool slightly. Serve warm with dipping sauce and garnish with fresh herbs if desired.
instructions.name: Serving Platter & Dipping Bowls

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm with marinara or vegan ranch as a dip. Great for parties or lunchboxes.
serving_and_storage.store: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days. Reheat in oven or air fryer.

pro_tips: Use parchment paper to prevent sticking and easy cleanup.
Red pepper flakes add a nice kick of heat if you like spice.
Freeze unbaked rolls and bake fresh when needed.

title: Vegetarian Quesadillas, Cheesy & Satisfying
description: If you're looking for a quick, satisfying, and meat-free meal, these Vegetarian Quesadillas are a must-try! Packed with colorful veggies, melted cheese, and perfectly toasted tortillas.
ingredients: 1.5 cups shredded cheddar or Mexican blend cheese
1 tbsp butter or olive oil for frying

instructions.title: Sauté the Veggies
instructions.description: Heat oil in a skillet. Add peppers, zucchini, and onion. Cook 5–6 minutes until soft. Add beans, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Cook 2 minutes more.
instructions.name: Non-stick skillet

instructions.title: Assemble the Quesadillas
instructions.description: Sprinkle cheese over half of each tortilla. Add veggie mixture. Fold tortilla in half.
instructions.name: Box grater

instructions.title: Cook Until Crispy
instructions.description: Cook each quesadilla in a skillet with butter/oil, 2–3 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy.
instructions.name: Silicone spatula

instructions.title: Slice and Serve
instructions.description: Slice into wedges and serve with sour cream, salsa, or guacamole.
instructions.name: Chef’s knife

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve hot with dips like guacamole, sour cream, or salsa.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 days. Reheat in a skillet for best texture.

pro_tips: Use a mix of cheeses like cheddar and Monterey Jack for extra flavor.
Add jalapeños for a spicy kick.
Press gently with a spatula while cooking to ensure even crisping.

title: Homestyle Vegetarian Lasagna
description: This Ultimate Vegetarian Lasagna is layered with tender pasta, sautéed veggies, creamy ricotta, and bubbling mozzarella — all baked to golden perfection. family-approved, and totally irresistible!

instructions.title: Sauté the Vegetables
instructions.description: Heat oil and sauté zucchini, bell pepper, mushrooms, and onion for 5–6 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Season and set aside.
instructions.name: Non-stick skillet

instructions.title: Prepare Cheese Mixture
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix ricotta, mozzarella, Parmesan, egg, and oregano until smooth.
instructions.name: Mixing bowls

instructions.title: Cook Noodles
instructions.description: Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
instructions.name: Silicone spatula

instructions.title: Assemble Lasagna
instructions.description: In a 9x13 baking dish, layer sauce, noodles, cheese mixture, vegetables. Repeat layers 3 times and top with remaining cheese and sauce.
instructions.name: Baking dish

instructions.title: Bake
instructions.description: Cover with foil and bake at 375°F for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake 15–20 more minutes until golden. Let rest before serving.

serving_and_storage.serve: Let rest 10 minutes after baking for easier slicing. Serve hot.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. Freeze for up to 2 months.

pro_tips: Use no-boil noodles for quicker prep.
Let the lasagna sit before cutting to hold its shape.
Add red chili flakes if you like a little heat.

title: Shrimp Scampi with Linguine
description: Classic shrimp scampi with garlic, lemon, and white wine sauce tossed with linguine. A quick, flavorful dinner ready in under 30 minutes.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/2 cup dry white wine or chicken broth
Salt and black pepper to taste

instructions.title: Cook the Linguine
instructions.description: Boil salted water in a large stockpot. Cook linguine until al dente (9–10 minutes). Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain.
instructions.name: large stockpot

instructions.title: Sauté the Shrimp
instructions.description: Heat olive oil and half the butter in a skillet. Cook shrimp 1–2 minutes per side until pink. Remove from skillet.
instructions.name: Non stick skillet

instructions.title: Make Scampi Sauce
instructions.description: Melt remaining butter in the same pan. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Sauté briefly, then add white wine. Simmer 2–3 minutes.
instructions.name: Non stick Pan

instructions.title: Toss Everything Together
instructions.description: Add pasta, shrimp, lemon juice, and reserved water. Toss and cook for 1–2 minutes until well mixed.
instructions.name: Mixing bowl

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Top with chopped parsley and optional lemon zest. Serve warm.

serving_and_storage.serve: Let rest 10 minutes after baking for easier slicing. Serve hot.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. Freeze for up to 2 months.

pro_tips: Use no-boil noodles for quicker prep.
Let the lasagna sit before cutting to hold its shape.
Add red chili flakes if you like a little heat.

title: Vegan Gyros: Greek-Inspired Wraps Bursting with Flavor
description: Savory marinated soy curls, fresh veggies, and creamy vegan tzatziki sauce wrapped in soft pita. Perfect for lunch or dinner.
ingredients: 1.5 cups soy curls (or 1 block firm tofu or mushrooms)
Optional: olives, pickled onions, hot sauce

instructions.title: Prepare the Soy Curls or Tofu
instructions.description: Soak soy curls in hot water for 10 minutes until plump. If using tofu, press and cut into strips.
instructions.name: Large Mixing Bowl & Tofu Press

instructions.title: Marinate the Protein
instructions.description: Combine olive oil, soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Mix in the soy curls or tofu and marinate for 15 minutes.
instructions.name: Mixing Bowl & Garlic Press

instructions.title: Cook the Protein
instructions.description: Heat a skillet and sauté the marinated soy curls or tofu until golden and crispy, about 8–10 minutes.
instructions.name: Cast Iron Skillet

instructions.title: Make Vegan Tzatziki
instructions.description: Mix grated cucumber, vegan yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, dill, and salt in a bowl. Chill until ready.
instructions.name: Box Grater & Mini Whisk

instructions.title: Warm Pita and Assemble
instructions.description: Warm pita in a pan or oven. Spread tzatziki, add soy curls/tofu, sliced tomato, onion, and lettuce. Wrap and enjoy.
instructions.name: Nonstick Frying Pan

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm with extra tzatziki or a side of lemony potatoes or salad.
serving_and_storage.store: Store the components separately in airtight containers. Use within 3 days for best texture.

pro_tips: Use soy curls for a meaty texture, but mushrooms or tofu work great too.
Make tzatziki in advance to let flavors meld.
To keep pita from tearing, warm it slightly before wrapping.

title: Moroccan Cauliflower with Tahini-Honey
description: Roasted cauliflower seasoned with bold Moroccan spices and finished with a creamy tahini-honey drizzle. A vibrant, healthy side or light plant-based dinner.
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, chopped into florets

instructions.title: Prep the Cauliflower
instructions.description: Chop cauliflower and toss with olive oil, smoked paprika, cumin, cinnamon, turmeric, salt, and pepper in a bowl until coated.
instructions.name: Chef’s knife

instructions.title: Roast It
instructions.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread cauliflower on a baking tray and roast for 25–30 minutes, flipping once, until golden.
instructions.name: Large baking tray

instructions.title: Make the Tahini-Honey Drizzle
instructions.description: Whisk tahini, honey, lemon juice, warm water, and salt in a small bowl until smooth. Add more water if needed for drizzling consistency.
instructions.name: Glass measuring cup

instructions.title: Serve and Garnish
instructions.description: Drizzle the sauce over roasted cauliflower and top with optional parsley, sesame seeds, or pomegranate arils.

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm, drizzled with tahini-honey and garnished with herbs or sesame seeds.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days. Reheat in oven or air fryer for best texture.

pro_tips: Use maple syrup instead of honey for a vegan version.
Add a pinch of red pepper flakes to the drizzle for a spicy twist.
Serve over couscous or quinoa for a full meal.

title: One-Pan Greek Chicken Meatballs with Lemon Orzo
description: Juicy Greek-style chicken meatballs cooked in one pan with creamy, lemony orzo for a comforting, Mediterranean-inspired dinner.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
Fresh dill or parsley for garnish

instructions.title: Make the Meatball Mixture
instructions.description: In a large bowl, mix ground chicken, garlic, onion, parsley, oregano, lemon zest, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, and pepper until just combined.
instructions.name: Large Mixing Bowl

instructions.title: Form and Sear Meatballs
instructions.description: Shape into meatballs (about 1.5 tbsp each) and sear in olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet until golden brown, about 4–5 minutes.
instructions.name: Nonstick Skillet with Lid

instructions.title: Add Orzo and Broth
instructions.description: Push meatballs aside. Add orzo, lemon juice, and chicken broth to the pan. Stir gently to combine.
instructions.name: Silicone Spatula

instructions.title: Simmer Until Tender
instructions.description: Cover and simmer on low for 10–12 minutes until orzo is tender and liquid is mostly absorbed, stirring occasionally.
instructions.name: Skillet with Glass Lid

instructions.title: Add Feta and Spinach
instructions.description: Stir in feta and spinach (if using). Cook uncovered for another 1–2 minutes until spinach wilts.
instructions.name: Feta Crumbler or Fork

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Top with fresh dill or parsley and more feta if desired. Serve warm with pita or salad.
instructions.name: Serving Bowls

serving_and_storage.serve: Serve warm with a side of Greek salad or warm pita bread.
serving_and_storage.store: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat with a splash of broth.

pro_tips: Don’t overmix the meatball mixture — keep it light for tender meatballs.
Use whole-wheat orzo for extra fiber.
Deglaze the pan with a splash of white wine for extra flavor.
